command.library

Class CmdFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • command.framework.Command
      • command.library.CmdFormat

  • public class CmdFormat
extends Command
    Format Command. After this command no files or directories remain in the root. Command Parameters:
    • (optional) /F : force format, e.g. no security check
    • (optional) drive letter

      • CmdFormat

    • Method Detail

      • checkNumberOfParameters

        protected boolean checkNumberOfParameters(int number)
        Description copied from class: Command
        Can be overwritten by the concrete commands if something must be checked. Checks if the number of parameters is in range. Do not output anything, an explaining error message is output by the abstract command.

        Template Method Pattern: Hook.
        Overrides:
        checkNumberOfParameters in class Command
        Parameters:
        number - Number of parameters passed by the caller.
        Returns:
        • true if number of parameters is within expected range
        • false otherwise

      • checkParameterValues

        protected boolean checkParameterValues(Outputter outputter)
        Description copied from class: Command
        Can be overwritten by the concrete commands if at least the value of one parameter must be checked. Checks all values of all passed parameters. An explaining error message must be output by the concrete command.

        Template Method Pattern: Hook.
        Overrides:
        checkParameterValues in class Command
        Parameters:
        outputter - The outputter must be used to output error messages.
        Returns:
        • true if all values of all parameters passed are correct.
        • false if at least one value of one parameter in incorrect.

      • execute

        public void execute(Outputter outputter)
        Description copied from class: Command
        Must be overwritten by the concrete commands to implement the execution of the command.
        Specified by:
        execute in class Command
        Parameters:
        outputter - Must be used to output any text.
